text: hey guys it's ro today we're gonna be
making some DIY of football treats this
weekend I'm having a Super Bowl party
and I just want to show you how to make
all these yummy themed snacks using my
eyeliner pencil just to get in the
spirit I've drawn some I black on my
little cheeks mmm
to make these yummy chocolate dip
football strawberries you'll need a
fresh bowl of strawberries you can use
as many as you'd like white chocolate
melt regular chocolate melt and a
plastic baggie I'm just using a little
frosting bag for the white chocolate now
we're gonna melt our chocolates I'm
heating mine up in the microwave and
once your chocolates are melted we are
gonna dip our strawberries I stuck a
toothpick into the middle of my
strawberry and then I'm slowly turning
it around to the chocolate trying not to
touch the greens gently lifting it up
letting the excess chocolate drip off
into the bowl and then I'm gonna set it
on a piece of wax paper to cool while
those are cooling take your plastic bag
and poured the melted white chocolate
inside I've put a number 2 tip on the
end to have a little bit more control
but I'm just putting a line at the top
of the strawberry and line at the bottom
of the strawberry and then drawing
little laces in between as best I can
and tada you can make as many as you
want for as many guests as you have
coming over I love chocolate dipped
strawberries um nom nom nom nom nom nom
these are one of my favorite treats in
the world the next thing that we're
gonna make are these yummy football
sliders I love them cuz they're just
bite-size they're like little mini
burgers what you're gonna need are
ciabatta rolls a cookie sheet pan a
brush a football shaped cookie cutter
like so a bunch of ground meat I'm using
beef but you can use turkey or whatever
you'd like this silicone football mold
from Wilton I love it it's so cute salt
and pepper olive oil mayonnaise and a
frying pan the first thing that we're
gonna do is cut your ciabatta rolls in
half and then place them onto the baking
sheet you're gonna take your football
cookie cutter and you're gonna cut out
football shapes into the bread so that
our buns will be the same shape as our
meat patties you're gonna do this to all
of them and you're gonna bake them in
the oven at 350 degrees for five minutes
or
so they've turned golden brown now take
your brush I'm dipping it into a little
bit of olive oil and spreading it around
each of the football mold so that our
patties will just slide out easily I'm
also taking a little salt and pepper
mixing it around with the ground meat
I'm just doing basic seasoning take a
small handful of meat and pack it into
the mold I'm filling the molds about 3/4
full and once you've filled all your
molds you're gonna put these in the oven
at 275 and bake for 14 minutes so that
they'll hold their football shape while
those are baking I'm just gonna cut some
fresh tomato slices and lettuce for our
sliders now pour some olive oil into the
pan on medium heat take your little
hamburgers that just came out of the
oven flip them upside down and the
hamburgers should fall right out into
the pan they should also keep their
shape because we baked them first and
now we're gonna finish cooking them on
the stove top depending on how you like
your meat rare medium rare or well-done
cook them as long as you want and then
they're ready to serve decorating these
sliders was really easy
I just put mani's into a plastic bag and
drew on the little football laces
omnomnom dome dome dome ROM these
sliders are now good to go the last
thing that we're gonna be making is this
football field chip dip I like it
because it's a variety of dips for
everyone there are so many different
things that we're gonna need so I'm just
gonna explain as we go the first thing
that we're gonna be making is ugly bean
dip you're gonna need one can of
vegetarian chili and one brick of cream
cheese for the chili into a medium-sized
saucepan over low heat you're gonna stir
it occasionally and add your brick of
cream cheese continue to stir these
together and it's called ugly bean dip
for a reason it is so ugly but it is so
delicious next we're gonna make some
guacamole I don't like to get fancy with
it I like my guacamole nice and simple
you're gonna take two ripe avocados cut
them in half take out the pit then cut
your avocado half into little squares so
you can easily scoop them into the bowl
chop up a handful of cilantro two
tablespoons of lime add them to the
mixture oh yeah
chop up some cherry tomatoes add however
many you would like add in that cilantro
mix it all around boom there we have it
fresh guacamole now we're gonna pour
everything into our casserole dish I've
made these little dividers out of
construction paper and I wrapped them in
saran wrap place them where you'd like
the end of the field to start put
something heavy behind it and now you're
just gonna pour in your ugly bean dip
yum yum yum yum yum and sprinkle some
cheddar cheese on the top for all the
cheese lovers now it's time to add the
guacamole I have some helping hands
thanks to mr. husky we're just putting
the guacamole on the field spreading it
flat and now for the other end zone I'm
gonna add salsa I didn't make this from
scratch but I really like this brand now
you're gonna remove your dividers just
gently jiggle them straight up up up up
to decorate the football field we're
gonna use sour cream I've scooped some
sour cream into this frosting bag with a
number five tip at the end and I'm just
gonna draw on the little field design
last but not least I made these pretzel
goalposts I attach the ends of the
pretzels using some melted chocolate
that we use for the strawberries just
assemble them let them dry for five
minutes and then we're gonna stick them
into both end zones I'm using a little
block of cheese to stabilize it in the
salsa end and tada there you have it
there's our football field chip dip last
thing I'm gonna do is make some
decoration these little football banners
for the party the things you'll need are
a hole punch scissors a pencil ribbon
liquid chalk marker two pieces of
scrapbook paper one Brown one green and
a ruler on the back side of your
scrapbook paper draw a bunch of little
triangles you can make them any size
you'd like and then cut all of them out
then you're gonna decorate each triangle
using your liquid chalk marker drawing
on little football laces take your hole
punch punch two holes on the top and
then take your ribbon and we're gonna
lace through every single triangle for
the banner
I'm just twisting the end of the ribbon
so that it will go through the whole
punch tool a little bit easier we're
starting on the back side and then
pulling the ribbon through onto the
front and then we're just gonna lace
through every single triangle to make
the banners Dada
our football banners are all done these
decorations are so easy to make I love
making them for parties we've got
football field chip dip and chip and
chocolate dipped footballs strawberries
and football sliders up I've got brown
brown brown y'all it's good huh I hope
you guys liked this DIY happy Super Bowl
weekend bye-bye
